Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ion Exchange Resin-Based Regional Citrate Anticoagulation in High Blood Flow Extracorporeal Circuits

Trial_Design.evidence: Six healthy swine (41.0 ± 3.1 kg) were sedated, ventilated, and connected to a prototype extracorporeal circuit.

Participants.evidence: Six healthy swine (41.0 ± 3.1 kg) were sedated, ventilated, and connected to a prototype extracorporeal circuit.

Intervention.evidence: Sodium citrate (5 mmol/L) was infused at the circuit inlet, and heparin was continuously infused.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates an innovative RCA technique using Ion Exchange Resin (i-ER) for high blood flow (500 mL/min) extracorporeal circuits.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the efficacy of i-ER in maintaining anticoagulation, measured over 2 hours.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Six healthy swine (41.0 ± 3.1 kg) were sedated, ventilated, and connected to a prototype extracorporeal circuit.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Citrate removal efficacy decreased from 93.8 ± 3.4% to 48.3 ± 1.5% over 2 hours (p < 0.001).
